name: nick chopper
sizes_available: kids to teen (s/m adult, l/xl adult)
notes:
nick chopper was designed to be emerald city yarn's first kal, and we invite you to join us!  this knit is the perfect relaxing knit.  simple, but offers a one color, two color, or work with the woolstok mini bundles for a super fun version!  

this pattern will remain free for the duration of the kal (nov 15-dec 15, 2025).  

**materials**
*yarn*
blue sky fibers woolstok (100% fine highland wool; 123yds/[112m]/50g)
sample is worked in 1314 deep velvet (color a) and 1324 morning frost (color b)
105 (112, 119)yds/[96 (102, 109)m] color a and
93 (100, 107)yds/[85 (91, 98)m] color b or
198 (212, 226) yds [181 (193, 207)m] total of a heavy dk or light worsted weight yarn.
optional: rico design make it blumchen in equivalent yardages to add a subtle sparkle.

*needles*
us 6 [4.0mm] - 16” circular and dpns
optional: needle 1-2 sizes smaller than your smaller needle for tubular co (any length)
or size to obtain gauge.

*notions*
4 stitch markers (with one being unique to indicate bor), tapestry needle

**gauge**
30sts x 32 rounds = 4” x 4”/[10cm x 10cm] in 1x1 ribbing pattern, unstretched and blocked.

**sizes**
kids to teen (s/m adult, l/xl adult)
to fit: 18-20 (20-22, 22-24)”/[45.5-51 (51-59, 59-61)cm] head circumference
this hat is very stretchy, the s/m adult size was able to fit a 23” head comfortably. if you prefer a snugger fit, choose a smaller size.

**finished dimensions**
15 (16, 17)”/[38 (40.5, 43)cm] unstretched circumference x 11.5 (11.75, 12)”/[29 (30, 30.5)cm] height
